instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.R7402: What is R7402? Resistor between PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP and CPUIMVP_TON. TON stands for TIME ON â€“ CPUIMVP_TON configures the buck converter for the CPU based on its input power supply. If this resistor is blown, the machine will turn on but not have any image, chime, or POST, because CPU vcore will be missing. This resistor is often the first to corrode because it is along a high voltage rail and it is right on the edge of the board, check this on 2011-2012 model Macbook Pros that turn on and do not chime. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message:
logic board is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, getting all the power except CPUVCORE.

checked resistance to ground on <RESISTOR>R7515</RESISTOR>,shorted to ground. replaced the CPU IC , no short anymore,getting about 0.600 sth.
check <RESISTOR>R7441</RESISTOR> (Since it's where the spilled was at) , it was 30 O, replaced and get 10 O.

power on but nothing change. checked Vron is there 3.3v. pin 46 29 16 all getting power. <RESISTOR>R7401</RESISTOR> is fine.

then i replaced mosfet <TRANSISTOR>Q7520</TRANSISTOR> <TRANSISTOR>Q7510</TRANSISTOR> ,still no change.

don't know where to go now. any help please?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message: checked <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7403</RESISTOR>, both looking good, one is 150K one is close to 180k

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message: Voltage on pin 1 and 48? Also resistance between pin 2 and 3

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message:
pin1 and 48 are getting around 12V.
resistance between pin2 and 3 is    5.83 M O

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message: I believe resistance between 2 and 3 should be 8K. Got another board to compare?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message: Just checked and it is 7.7K, so check your soldering on <RESISTOR>R7441</RESISTOR> and the traces to <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message:
thanks for the hint, i think i found the problem. pin 2 of <RESISTOR>R7441</RESISTOR> to ground resistance is 670 sth. it's supposed to be close to 0 as i compare on the good board. that's why im not getting 7.7k between 2 and 3.

not sure if pin2 of <RESISTOR>R7441</RESISTOR> had been corroded in the layers, it's directly connected to the cpu, i checked the none-stuff pin 1of <RESISTOR>R1361</RESISTOR>,it's connected to pin2 of <RESISTOR>R7441</RESISTOR>, but it's also getting 670 sth,not 0. so seems like the trace between the cpu and pin2 of <RESISTOR>R7441</RESISTOR> is bad?  but there is no place i can jump a wire

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message:
FIXED!!! i removed the <RESISTOR>R7441</RESISTOR> on the good board to check . found pin 1 was close to 0 and pin 2 is not reading. that means the pull down to 0 is from pin 1 not pin 2.
so pin1 is from the IC so , thought should be the IC, (that's actually the third one i replaced already) but anyway,i replaced another one. STILL DIDN'T GET CLOSE TO 0,
damn , then i was trying to get the schematics of MAX15119 and see the internal design and see why it's giving out 600 sth instead of 0. not available online.
i think once the chip is on , that pin should be pulled down. so I just jump a wire from GND to pin1 , pulled down that pin1 . damn then it worked!! now doing ASD on it

(I'm talking about pin1 and pin 2 of <RESISTOR>R7441</RESISTOR>,not the MAX IC)

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message: but anyway,thanks a lot DUKE!!!without your suggestion,we wouldn't doubt that pin at the first place!!!

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message:
You have now messed up the sense circuit for Vcore. If you want to ground anything it should be pin 2 of <RESISTOR>R7441</RESISTOR>, grounding pin 2 on <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> directly may have unexpected effects.
Pin 2 of <RESISTOR>R7441</RESISTOR> should go to the "local" voltage sense on the CPU and will be pretty much a short to GND

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message:
But i removed <RESISTOR>R7441</RESISTOR> on two good boards to check, after i remove <RESISTOR>R7441</RESISTOR>, pin2 is not 0V in diod mode, but pin 1 is, so I thought the "short to ground" side should be from <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>. that's why i grounded there.
I ran it the whole afternoon and no errors in ASD and OS running.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message: Oh well, leave it and if there are any issues you known where to look.
